avalancheActivity.highlights: Locally increased avalanche danger in the upper reaches of valleys bordering Piedmont.
avalancheActivity.comment:
In the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 3 (considerable) the avalanche prone locations are more prevalent.
The new snow of the last few days is lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in particular on steep shady slopes.
As a consequence of the light to moderate wind, fresh snow drift accumulations formed during the last few days.
Mostly the avalanches are shallow but can be released in some cases even by a single winter sport participant, especially on very steep slopes.
Several small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized snow slides and avalanches are possible as a consequence of the new snow.

snowpackStructure.comment:
10 to 15 cm of snow, but less in some localities, has fallen since Saturday above approximately 2000 m. 5 to 20 cm of snow will fall on Tuesday above approximately 2000 m.
Large-grained weak layers exist in the old snowpack on shady slopes. In all altitude zones a little snow is lying on south facing slopes. At intermediate and high altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. The numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow are the main danger.

tendency.highlights: In some localities up to 10 cm of snow will fall on Wednesday.

avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2400 m.
avalancheActivity.comment:
The fresh and older wind slabs are lying on the unfavourable surface of an old snowpack in particular on very steep shady slopes. Single winter sport participants can release avalanches in some places. In some places the avalanches can be triggered in the faceted old snow, in particular on very steep slopes.
Several mostly small snow slides and avalanches are possible as a consequence of the new snow.

snowpackStructure.comment:
2 to 10 cm of snow has fallen since Saturday above approximately 2000 m. 2 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, will fall on Tuesday above approximately 2000 m.
The weather conditions gave rise to gradual moistening of the snowpack in some cases especially at low and intermediate altitudes. Large-grained weak layers exist in the old snowpack on shady slopes. In all altitude zones a little snow is lying on south facing slopes. At intermediate and high altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. The numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow are the main danger.

tendency.highlights: 5 to 10 cm of snow will fall on Wednesday above approximately 2000 m.

regions.name: B - VALLI DI GRESSONEY, AYAS, CHAMPORCHER

avalancheActivity.highlights: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on steep shady slopes above approximately 2300 m.
avalancheActivity.comment:
Mostly the avalanches are shallow but can be released in some cases by a single winter sport participant, in particular on very steep slopes.
The avalanches can be triggered in the faceted old snow and reach medium size in isolated cases.
Several mostly small avalanches are possible as a consequence of the moist air.

snowpackStructure.comment:
2 to 5 cm of snow has fallen since Saturday above approximately 2200 m. 2 to 10 cm of snow, but less in some localities, will fall on Tuesday above approximately 2000 m.
Weak layers exist in the old snowpack on shady slopes.
The weather conditions gave rise to moistening of the snowpack especially at low and intermediate altitudes.
At intermediate and high altitudes snow depths vary greatly, depending on the infuence of the wind. The numerous rocks hidden by the recent snow are the main danger.

tendency.highlights: Little snow will fall on Wednesday.
